timeline.bodyText:
can't we just retry calling getQueryInfo once again in a while?
Wouldn't simple assertEventually work here?
timeline.author: losipiuk

replies.bodyText:
When I've investigated similar problems in the past it seemed that sometimes query stats updates get applied seconds after the query finishes, an sometimes they get lost in transfer. I suspect network problems to be the cause, but I never spent enough time to confirm this.
This is why the query itself also needs to be resubmitted - getting stats repeatedly for the same query won't help if  coordinator already finished collecting stats updates for this particular query.
As for using assertEventually - It would be easier to understand, but the race condition in each retry would have the same chances of happening. Thanks to RetryDriver separating onRetry, run and exponential backoff, we can increase sleep times between the query and asking for it's stats, so the race condition has less of a chance of happening.

Fix flaky testParquetTimestampPredicatePushdown

Query info contains zeroes if updates haven't been applied yet.
Fixed by retrying with increasing delay between query and getQueryInfo.
